facts: Many tobacco companies hid data that would showed the addictiveness of nicotine
Many tobacco compaines developed new flavors with the simple purpose of getting more youth addicted to their products
Many tobacco companies have directly targeted certain vulnerable communities with the aim of hooking them specifically to their products
Electronic Cigarettes are just as addicitive as other tobacco products
E-cigarette aerosol is NOT harmless “water vapor”, and is in fact very harmful
Vapors from vapes and tobacco products not only harm you, but are also harmful to bystanders
More than 16 million Americans are living with a disease caused by smoking
Smoking is a known cause of erectile dysfunction in males
Cigarette smoking is responsible for more than 480,000 deaths per year in the United States, which accounts for around 20% of all deaths
On average, smokers die 10 years earlier than nonsmokers
Each day, about 2000 people younger than 18 years smoke their first cigarette
Cigarette smoke contains more than 7,000 chemicals, 70 of which are known to cause cancer
Nearly 9 out of 10 smokers start before the age of 18 and almost all start smoking by age 26
Tobacco is the leading cause of preventable death in the world
Tobacco kills more than 8 million people each year, translating to one smoking-related death every five seconds
Over 16 million Americans are currently living with a tobacco-related disease
A typical cigarette can contain anywhere from 8 to 9 milligrams of nicotine
There is enough nicotine in five cigarettes to kill an average adult if ingested whole
Of the 8 million smoking-related deaths reported around the world each year, 1.2 million are the result of secondhand smoke
Tobacco costs the U.S. economy more than $300 billion each year
Statistics suggest that 5.6 million children living today in the U.S. will die of a smoking-related disease
Globally, tobacco use has claimed more than 100 million lives in the 20th century. It is expected to claim another billion during the 21st century.
The World Health Orginization has concluded that half of all smokers will die as a result of tobacco use
Cigarette smoking is the leading cause of preventable deaths in the United States

healthUp.title: Cases of death are going up
What are you doing, people are dying
You made some profit, but at what cost?
People are dying, what will you do about it?
More people are dying due to your tobacco products
The courts must put an end to this
Tobacco is killing people, what will the goverment do about it?

healthDown.title: Cases of death are going down
Less people are dying because of your products, but it is not 0
It is a start, let us hope it keeps going down
People are still dying, you should do better
Cases are going down, but there are still people dying
Tobacco products are still killing people

marketShareUp.title: S T O N K S
Market Share went up, but at what cost?
Sure, you made money, but was it worth it?
One step closer to your goal. One step farther from that of humanity

marketShareDown.title: Your market share went down, better fix it or else you are FIRED
